title: Ground News - Derry bishop criticised over denial of Gaza crib
text:
Summary by Ground News Bishop of Derry turned down request to place crib in his church. The crib features a baby Jesus wrapped in a Palestinian keffiyeh. The charity is not affiliated to any political party, it said. It is a registered charity which works for human rights for Palestinians. Share menu More

derrydaily.net Derry bishop criticised over denial of Gaza crib Derry-based group the Ireland Palestine Solidarity Campaign has criticised a decision not to allow it to place a “community nativity crib for Gaza” in a Catholic church. ISPC chairwoman Catherine Hutton asked Bishop of Derry the Most Reverend Donal McKeown to place the crib – featuring a rocket with the words “Made in USA” – in a church between December 22 and January 6.
